head.title: World Business Briefing | Europe: Penalties for Product Piracy Advance

hedline.hl1: World Business Briefing | Europe: Penalties for Product Piracy Advance

block.p: Endorsing a set of common criminal penalties across the European Union for the first time, the European Parliament approved legislation that would impose jail sentences and fines on counterfeiters of drugs, toys and other goods in the 27-country bloc. The legislation, which still must be approved by national governments, aims to protect consumers from unsafe products like fake Viagra pills or imitation condoms, while preventing the infringement of intellectual property in the music and film industry. .
